featured.text: Earworms can run around our heads for several minutes to numerous hours.
Recent or repeated exposure to a song or even a small part of a song can also trigger earworms, as can word associations, such as a phrase similar to the lyrics of a song.
While earworms might be annoying, most people who experience them nevertheless report that they are pleasant or at least neutral.
According to the passage, which of the following is true about an earworm? (A) It is a creature living inside our ears.
They use a range of terms to describe it—stuck-song syndrome, sticky music, cognitive itch, or most commonly “earworm.”

other.text: What people use to kill earworms.
Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a feature that would trigger earworms? (A) Tunes repeatedly encountered.
How people cope with their earworms seems to depend on how they feel about them.

definition.zh_def: 耳蟲，指一段旋律或歌曲在腦海中反覆出現，難以忘懷。
definition.en_def: A catchy piece of music or melody that keeps repeating in one's mind.
definition.example: That song is such an earworm; I can't stop humming it!
